PSMIsoModif
object in module matches

Description

contains a list of psms who have the same sequence and set of modifications

Usage

PSMIsoModif(args);

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
argsObject

compulsory properties, containing

  • {Array} psms the underlying PSM
  • {Map} fixModif a map of modifications appearing across all peptides, in the format modif -> {pos: [i1,...]}
  • {Map} varModif a map of modifications appearing in peptides, but at different position, in the format modif -> {count:n, pos:[i1, i2, ...]}. Here the

Methods

  • countPSM()

    get the number of PSM used to build

    Returns
    Number

    nb PSM

  • getDescription()()

    return the built in description

    Returns
    String

    a description

  • getFixModif()

    modification present on all PSMS

    Returns
    Object

    a map {modif -> {pos:[i1,...]}}

  • getMyPSMIsoModif()

    the list PSM grouped by Iso Modif (same set of modif by sequence

    Returns
    Array

    list of PSMIsoModif

  • getPSMs()

    the list of underlying PSM

    Returns
    Array

    list of PSM

  • getVarModif()

    modification present on all PSMS, but with different positions combinations

    Returns
    Object

    a map {modif -> {count:n, pos:[i1,i2,...]}} where n is of course lower than the number of potential positions

  • hasUniquePSM()

    check if there only on psms

    Returns
    PSM

    undefined if multiple PSMS are contained, or the one if there is only one

  • proteinList()

    get the proteinList (the proteinList of the first PSM, as they should all be equivalent)

    Returns
    Number

    nb PSM
